If they had kept to the open area idea they did in the start of this game it might have been different enough\, but they choose not to.Visual design and acting are the only things keeping this game afloat from a 0 imo\, and normally i could give this game a 7 or 8 out of 10 if the direction of the story wasn't so horrendously bad. There are so many better ways Druckmann could have rearranged the telling of this story so that people didn't outright HATE one of the characters. There are so many ways the story telling of this game could have been written to enjoy it better\, maybe not entirely because the most overwhelming feeling that seems oddly designed make you hate the characters you play. Granted a unique but un-enjoyable way to play a video game.What was clear from the beginning; a story of love\, vengence and Jewish history. I mean\, there is SO much of the overtones and in your face Israeli-Palestine conflict and Jewish culture in this game I began to think it wasn't even about the main characters. It became just a bloody message of awareness to the middle eastern conflicts. I feel for the people lost in conflict and for those who feel so much hate in this world\, and I enjoy a deep soul discovering story as much as the next person but forcing you to play as a character you hate is such a horrible way to experience a story much less to PLAY A GAME.The writing for this game is on par with what i expect Naughty Dog to do\, it does have a really good voice but I feel for the employees at Naughty Dog and the cast of this game\, they did an amazing job and it's not their fault the direction of the game was so poorly designed\, Niel Druckmann was just not reigned in by Bruce Straley this time.
